history.content: CS 61B this semester is not that bad, tests are hard but easier for me compared to midterm 2 and final of John DeNero's CS 61A (but most people told me that Hilfinger's CS 61A is much easier). Don't really know about CS 70 during summer. If you want to keep a higher GPA, take CS 70 during summer and then Hilfinger's CS 61B (the grade distribution is very generous). If you want to get an internship, take CS 61BL during summer and then CS 70 next fall.

Don't really know about CS 70 during summer. If you want to keep a higher GPA, take CS 70 during summer and then Hilfinger's CS 61B (the grade distribution is very generous). If you want to get an internship, take CS 61BL during summer and then CS 70 next fall.

children.subject: I've heard most big companies recruit heavily during fall, so there will be fewer seats available during spring.
Not OP here, but I assume "If you want to get an internship, take CS 61BL during summer and then CS 70 next fall." is because companies interview for summer internship in the fall?
You can still get an internship after fall semester too taking 61b, a bunch of people I know did this including me
Actually CS 61BL do have large project. This summer Gitlet is on the assignment list.

Oh cool. I didn't get to do Gitlet, but I did text editor. I really liked 61B during the year because it was fun to go in depth. I personally did not like 70 and so my advise is to take it during the summer. In the end, either will probably be fine, but if you want to take a summer class, I recommend 70.
Is it better to take CS 61B and 70 together during fall?

If you are looking for this summer, 70 has been full for months. Unless of course you are alreays enrolled :) I took 70, 61B, and a r&c together and it was fine. 61B and 70 do require a solid chunk of time to understand and then do the assignments. Especially because of the GPA cap, they can certainly be taken together but not much more. If you want to take a class, or not doing anything else, go ahead and take one, but otherwise, focus on a side project (great for recruitment) over the summer and take both during the fall.

My opinion is take 70 over the summer. People say its easier but you also have to opportunity to focus on that class because it is tough. And on the side study some data structures. Companies do recruit in the Fall and data structures are important, but you can self study a little and do prep from cracking the coding interview and stuff to prepare. 61B during the year goes into more depth and I felt that the large projects really help and make the class so great. It is definitely worth taking during the year.

I heard from a lot of people who followed the advice of taking 70 over the summer last summer because it's easier complain and say that the class felt too rushed and it wasn't that much easier. I could definitely see that as in 70, you basically learn a new concept every lecture. However, for recruiting, you can also easily study CTCI and that should be sufficient. I recruited last fall while taking 61b and still did fine and got a good internship as my interviews were in November/ late October when the data structure part of the course was already covered and was into sorting (but that stuff can be very easily self studied). 

I think either choice is fine.
I agree, 70 during the semester does move fast. But its also hard to focus on 70 all the time during the year, so even if it is fast paced over summer, you have less to worry about in my opinion.

Actually I feel that the subjects in CS 70 need enough time to understand since they very tough (especially graph theory). Semester CS 70 already goes very fast (sometimes one lecture per topic) so I really don't know what pace will summer version goes. Maybe the course goes faster and the test is easier?

history.content: My current dilemma is whether I should take 61BL in the summer and take 70 in the fall, or vice versa. I've heard that cs 70 in the summer is known to be much easier than cs 70 during the semester, but I have concerns about taking 61B while applying for internships/jobs in the fall, as I've heard that there is a lot of 61b knowledge that's tested in interviews. I'm an incoming junior trying to double in CS, so applying for internships this fall is pretty vital. I did well in 61A so I'm not extremely worried about the GPA cap at the moment.
history.subject: Importance of 61B for internships/recruitment (61B vs 70 for summer)
